content: Love the app, does exactly what I was looking for! One small thing/question though - I additionally have an alarm clock app, which is hard to switch off in the morning because the alarm is no longer displayed on the screen. Is there a way for an alarm clock to override the night clock screen?
replyContent:
Hello,

I guess you are using Android 10 or 11?
The alarm app should take care that it can be "displayed above other apps" when the alarm goes off.
My App "Radio Alarm Clock" for example is simply shown above the running night clock when the alarm kicks in. What alarm app are you using? Ben

content: Doesn't have the capability to include an alarm setting.
replyContent: What alarm setting? It's a clock display app for the night, not an alarm application. The Play Store description is quite clear about that. Or what exactly do you mean? If you are looking for a night clock with a real alarm function, you might want to check my other app 'Radio Alarm Clock++' which is both in one.

content: Just what I needed. Only wish there was an option to lock it in horizontal display mode.

I love this. I had the free version, but decided I had to make the tiny gesture of buying it in order to give thanks to the developer since I use it so much. My only wee suggestion is to have the option to display only the date below the time, rather than the changing date / battery level. Great job, thank you! Update: yes that option is now added, and I can't think of anything else that is needed! üëçüèª
replyContent: I guess you noticed that you now have this option? üôÇ Thanks for your review and your support. Kind regards, Benjamin Laws

content: Super nice app now that the builder helped me figure it out. Thank you
replyContent:
Edit: Oh I'm sorry, I was confused with the apps... The icon of this one is almost the same as the free App's icon, except for the '++'. I'm glad you figured it out. :)

Great to see, thanks for the update. If you have any questions you can send a mail anytime. Greetings, Ben

content: Does what it says, easy to use with no fuss, good options, simple to use.
This app is awesome delivers as promised I love it!
replyContent: Hey what more colors do you want? Background is black, that's set for the purpose of night display. But for font color you are close to 16.7mio combinations of free choice of color - not enough? :) If you set it to custom/own color you can adjust RGB right to your needs. Greetings!

content: Paid for the full version. Clock does not come on automatically when I plug charger in. Please refund. Yes, I wouldn't leave a review until I had tried the correct settings
replyContent:
Did you check the auto start setting in your energy settings? 

Please send an email with the GPA.xxxx. ... Number, so I can find your purchase and refund it. Ben 

EDIT: I have not yet received a mail. I still offer the refund, but I need the number from your purchase acknowledgment email.

content: App does just what it says it will do.
Exactly what I was looking for as a nightstand clock. It doesn't always launch automatically when put on the charger unfortunately hence the 4* review.
replyContent: Hey, please check under 'device maintenance' settings if the app is listed under 'apps in standby' or 'deactivated apps'. (Best would be to switch those modes off completely). I hope it will help. I can send screenshots if you send a mail. Ben

content: Simply to use and does the job. Display rotates slowly around the screen to avoid burning in.
Can't switch alarm off in morning and didn't look like screen text moved all night
replyContent: Hi, the text is moving every 5 minutes (unless you set the size too big and there is no space to the left and right), please test it. What alarm? This is only a clock, no alarm app.

content: Having problems keeping color. Starts out blue which i like at night but turns white during the night and is annoying. Also only way to start it is to plug into charging. If you look at another app and stop it .. It totally stops only way to start is unplug from charge and replug. Like the fact it floats around when working but have issues
replyContent:
Hi, turning white: please pull your notifi.drawer down, you might find a bedtime or night mode button there. This is turning the screen to black and white. Automatic switch times might be set.
'Power plug auto app start' can be switched off in app settings. The app can be started manually via app drawer starter icon. App can be closed with BACK btn

content: Love this app. Exactly the simplicity and usefulness I was looking for.
